page.title: 13LAW AND ORDER
page.content: { } There has been a Police House in Sidlesham since 1948.P.C. Bowerman lives and works there. He uses his motorbike most of the time but sometimes he uses his car. His shifts are eight hours long but his office is open all the time. He is told by either Selsey or Chichester Police Station what he has to do.His area covers Sidlesham, Hunston, North and South Mundham, Lagness and Pagham Harbour. Pagham Harbour has 21 by_laws from West Sussex County Council. Anyone who breaks these laws can be fined Â£20. The laws protect the wildlife in the Nature Reserve from being damaged by the visitors. You are not allowed to use a boat or water_ski and you are not allowed to camp or light fires. The wardens are there to make sure that you keep to these laws.
